description: The BHS segment defines the start of a batch

fields.name: Batch Field Separator
fields.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

fields.name: Batch Encoding Characters
fields.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

fields.name: Batch Sending Application
fields.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

fields.name: Batch Sending Facility
fields.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

fields.name: Batch Receiving Application
fields.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

fields.name: Batch Receiving Facility
fields.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

fields.name: Batch Creation Date / Time
fields.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

fields.name: Batch Security
fields.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

fields.name: Batch Name / Id / Type
fields.description: can be used by the application processing the batch.  It can have extra components if needed

fields.name: Batch Comment
fields.description: comment field that is not further defined in the HL7 protocol

fields.name: Batch Control Id
fields.description: used to uniquely identify a particular batch.  It can be echoed back in BHS-12-reference batch control ID if an answering batch is needed

fields.name: Reference Batch Control Id
fields.description: value of BHS-11-batch control ID when this batch was originally transmitted.  Not present if this batch is being sent for the first time.  See definition for BHS-11-batch control ID
